hints.content: First, think about how you can read the contents of a file in your programming language of choice. Most languages have built-in functions to open and read files. Consider how you would read the file line by line.
Remember that lines in a file are typically indexed starting from 0 or 1, depending on the language. If you want the 10th line, make sure you know how to access it correctly based on the indexing.
Consider using a loop to iterate through each line of the file. You can keep a counter to track which line you are currently on. Once your counter reaches 10, you can print that line.
Think about what you should do if the file has fewer than 10 lines. You might want to print a specific message or handle this case in a way that makes sense for your application.
If you're using a language that allows you to read all lines into a list or array, consider how you would access the 10th element directly. However, be cautious about the indexing differences.
When reading the file, make sure to handle potential errors, such as the file not existing or being unreadable. Itâ€™s good practice to include error handling in your code.
You might want to explore different methods to read the file, such as using built-in functions or libraries that simplify file handling. Research the best practices for your chosen language.
If you're using a command-line interface, consider how you might achieve this task using shell commands. There are often built-in commands that can simplify reading specific lines from a file.

Consider using a single-pass approach to read the file. You can read each line and check if it's the 10th line, printing it immediately if it is. This can be more efficient than reading all lines at once.
Finally, think about how you would structure your code to ensure it is clean and easy to read. Use functions or methods to encapsulate the logic of reading the file and retrieving the 10th line.

questionNotes: If the file contains less than 10 lines, you should handle this case gracefully, possibly by printing a message or returning nothing.
Lines are typically indexed starting from 1 for this problem, so the 10th line corresponds to index 10.
Ensure you consider edge cases, such as an empty file or a file with fewer than 10 lines.
